metadata.title: CVE-2019-12855 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In words.protocols.jabber.xmlstream in Twisted through 19.2.1, XMPP supportdid not verify certificates when used with TLS, allowing an attacker toMITM connections.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-twisted - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python-twisted-bin - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python-twisted-core - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python-twisted-mail - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python-twisted-names - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python-twisted-news - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python-twisted-runner - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python-twisted-web - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python-twisted-words - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python3-twisted - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python3-twisted-bin - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
python-twisted-conch - 1:17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: twisted package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1').
twisted package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '17.9.0-2ubuntu0.1').
